• Committees
  • Land Acknowledgment
University of Texas at Austin
Associated Students of Linguistics

Welcome

ASOL is the official graduate student organization of UT Linguistics. We advocate for the interests of graduate students in departmental affairs, organize events relevant to graduate students' academic success, and provide a social support network.

Land Acknowledgment

We would like to acknowledge that we work and live on Indigenous land. Moreover, We would like to acknowledge and pay our respects to the Carrizo & Comecrudo, Coahuiltecan, Caddo, Tonkawa, Comanche, Lipan Apache, Alabama-Coushatta, Kickapoo, Tigua Pueblo, and all the American Indian and Indigenous Peoples and communities who have been or have become a part of these lands and territories in Texas, here on Turtle Island.

Executive Committee

Kirsten, Scott, Mackenzie, Seyeon, Mike

Duties

Conduct ASOL meeting in September, re-register ASOL with Student Activities in November & April, assist in organizing other ASOL projects as necessary. [info on annual registration] [rules regarding student organizations]

Treasurer

Kennedy (Advisor: Laura)

Duties

Manage the bank account information, and work with other committees (e.g. TLS) to disperse funds.

GSA Representative

Sarah (Alternate: Austin)

Duties

Attend fortnightly Graduate Student Assembly (GSA) meetings, report back on relevant issues, and poll graduate students on important votes. [GSA website]

Anti-Racism Committee

Frances, Elijah, Sarah, Mike

Duties

Maintain resources on anti-racist action in academia and (in collaboration with faculty) provide accountability to the steps outlined in the department's anti-racism statement.

IRB Representative

Jaime

Duties

Keep students informed of major changes to the Institutional Review Board (IRB) process. Tony Woodbury is the current faculty IRB coordinator.

Workstations Coordinator

Dag

Duties

Assign cubicles and update the map each year.

Digital Resources Committee

May, Elijah

Duties

Maintain websites (ASOL, TLS, SALSA); manage the Slack workspace; create other 'digital resources' as necessary.

Phi Beta Kappa Representative

Lizzy

Duties

Represent ASOL at any Phi Beta Kappa events.

Colloquium Liaison

Kristie, Seyeon

Duties

Work with faculty to choose colloquium speakers.

Courses Liaison

Gabriella

Duties

Consult with administration about the graduate course offerings each semester.

Open House Committee

Taylor, James, Katya, Barrett

Duties

Organize the open house for admitted students each Spring (living accommodations, travel, and events). Someone on this committee should have a car.

TLS Committee

Feb 2021: Sophie, Gabriella, Venkat, Caitie (advisor)
Feb 2022: Barrett, Kennedy, Taylor

Duties

Organize the annual linguistics conference (Texas Linguistics Society) in the early spring. [TLS website]

SALSA Representatives

Apr 2021: Elijah, Paige Erin, Mike (advisor)

Duties

Organize a spring conference in conjunction with English, Anthropology, Communication, and other departments. [SALSA website]

Defense Parties

Cristian, Lizzy, May, Caitie

Duties

Organize parties after dissertation defenses (snacks, cake, champagne). Someone on this committee should have a car.

(During the COVID-19 pandemic, these parties have taken the form of a Zoom gathering & organizing a cake to be delivered to the defender's home.)

Happy Hours

May, Taylor, Paige Erin

Duties

Organize periodic social events for the department (usually at places close to campus that have both alcohol and good food).

Holiday Potluck

Scott, Sarah

Duties

Organize a potluck event at the end of the fall semester (often hosted by Steve Wechsler).

Spring BBQ

Venkat, Barrett

Duties

Organize a potluck event at the end of the spring semester (usually hosted by someone who has a large courtyard area, or in a park). Someone on this committee should have a car.
